definition: to burn incense
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to burn incense and worship Buddha

lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/to make a hasty last-minute effort (often refers to cramming for exams)
pinyin: ping2 shi2 bu4 shao1 xiang1 , lin2 shi2 bao4 fo2 jiao3
containing_words.word: 平时不烧香，临时抱佛脚

definition: to choose which Buddha to burn incense to (idiom); fig. to curry favor from the right person

sentences.english: This paper takes"Incense Burning"rite in XiuYan area as an object.
sentences.chinese: 本文以岫岩地区“烧香”仪式为研究对象。

sentences.english: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.
sentences.chinese: 烧香的时后，众百姓在外面祷告。

sentences.english: He goes to the temple to burn joss sticks every 15th day of the month.
sentences.chinese: 每逢既望之日他都会去寺庙烧香。

sentences.english: Uzziah, who had a censer in his hand ready to burn incense, became angry.
sentences.chinese: 乌西雅就发怒，手拿香炉要烧香。

sentences.english: Have not heard a word " fortune-telling rich burn incense and poor, " saying it?
sentences.chinese: 有没有听过一句话“穷算命富烧香”这句话呀？

sentences.english: The temples were closed, and this sort of thing simply wasn't allowed.
sentences.chinese: 过去庙都给关了，这样烧香拜佛是不允许的。

sentences.english: Cheng's wife put her money on the table, lit joss sticks and kowtowed just like others there.
sentences.chinese: 成名的妻子把钱放在案上，象前边的人一样烧香跪拜。

sentences.english: When the burn sticks and paper's money, they believe joss can bless my family.
sentences.chinese: 当烧香和纸钱时，他们相信佛祖会保佑我们家。

sentences.english: The nun wished to burn incense before her golden Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 尼姑想给她的金佛烧香，又不愿意让别的佛像占便宜。

sentences.english: To pray for health, every pilgrim would incense and worship here.
sentences.chinese: 想祈求健康去除病魔的信徒们都要到这里烧香拜佛。

sentences.english: His friends and family burnt incense and Chinese money for the afterlife.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友和野人为他的去世烧香和焚烧纸钱。

sentences.english: Make an altar of acacia wood for burning incense.
sentences.chinese: 你要用皂荚木做一座烧香的坛。

sentences.english: Embrace Buddha's feet in one' hour of need.
sentences.chinese: 闲时不烧香，临时抱佛脚。

sentences.english: Place the gold altar of incense in front of the ark of the Testimony and put the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
sentences.chinese: 把烧香的金坛安在法柜前，挂上帐幕的门帘。

sentences.english: 9he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
sentences.chinese: 照祭司的规矩掣签，得进主殿烧香。

sentences.english: Uzziah, who had a censer in his hand ready to burn incense , became angry.
sentences.chinese: 乌西雅就发怒，手拿香炉要烧香。

definition: to burn incense and worship Buddha
to burn incense at a temple
to worship Buddha
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
to burn incense
to pray for blessings
to abstain from eating meat/to be a vegetarian
incense burning in front of a temple/burning joss sticks
Buddhist pilgrim/Buddhist worshipper
to offer sacrifice (to one's ancestors)
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to recite or chant Buddhist scripture
joss stick and candle
to burn incense
donations to a temple
lay practitioners of Buddhism
